comment: This class is required to apply to the Coles College of Business and counts for 0 credits. You were graded on 8 assignments, one being a syllabus quiz. Overall this was an easy class as long as you complete the assignments.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: great professor. she sent weekly emails to let you know what was missing. assignments due on weds. assignments were not difficult at all, got them done in like 2-3 hours and there were like 9 of them. you can get ahead also and finish early. also you can do the online assignment instead of going in person.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: AMAZINGGGG PROFESSOR! There are just 9 assignments for this class, really easy and super fun! I love how Professor Quiroga sent weekly emails just to remind students of assignments, what needed to be completed or what you have already completed. I love how she took the time out to really care for her students. 10000/10 professor!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Super easy class with only 9 assignments. She sends monthly emails to check your completion status and the course is very well organized. Definitely reccomend!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment:
Easy class you do the work every Wednesday should only take you 2-4 hours if you do it in one day. Follow the instructions and you will get Satisfactory. I did with 4 other classes it could be done with 5.
ends in mid november
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: EASY CLASS. In fact, you could finish this class like a month or two months. She is very easy grader that she doesn't care if the work is perfect or need correction. AS LONG YOU COMPLETE THE WORK then your good to go. One thing she does email you of what work is completed or incomplete so please take her

50% hybrid class. You have the option of going in person to attend the events which is a better option compared to writing long assignments at home if you don't go in person. Pretty easy grader as long as you follow the instructions and get the stuff done in time. 10 total assignments that you can work ahead on if you want to finish the course up.

Not much to say about the professor herself, but the class was simple, do all the assignments in order to pass. Going to events is the easiest way to knock out elective assignments. Don't make the mistake of waiting to do assignments, instead do them early so you can focus on hard classes. This can easily be done with four other courses.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: This was a very easy class. Although it is tedious, it's one of the easiest classes I've ever taken. No tests or finals. Just an assignment and electives due each week. I will say I didn't like how things were due by 3 pm and not 11:59 pm but that was my only complaint.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment: This teacher is easy. She tells you exactly what she wants and if you do it you will pass easily. This is a mini-semester, yet it was not overwhelming. If you follow her plan or do it faster you will come to the end of the semester surprised that's the only work you had. There is 6b assignments and 6 side activities that you get to pick.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: This class is half a semester and there are 2 assignments due every Wednesday at 3 each week. You use the app suitable and handshake in order to do your work.

Professor Quiroga was awesome! She knows her stuff and is very caring about her students. It's not an easy A but you have every opportunity in the world to do well in this class. She is always available and always helpful. Assignments are always relevant to the subject. Good class!

I would definitely take this professor again. Not an Automatic A, but every tool you need to get an A she gives you willingly. Also gives plenty and meaningful extra credit opportunities. Attendance is more about participation than it is showing up for every class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Take this professor! She is really good. Made the senior level course fly by and easy to understand. She does not give you busy work, and will provide you with ample opportunities to raise your grade throughout the semester. Pay attention and you will be set.

Quiroga was amazing! Her old name was Duncan, so that is why many people may be confused. Her tests were very easy if you do the study guides! She doesn't try to trick us. You have 4 tests, a project, & participation for a grade. Because of COVID-19 she let us choose between the project or a test. TAKE HER! I wish she taught more classes! THE BEST!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: A lot of work, but a caring and understanding professor.
Uses another professor's material. A LOT of assignments every week. Group work heavy. Difficult quizzes. Not the best.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Professor Quiroga is a Six-Sigma Black Belt. She leads process improvement initiatives for the university, and teaches this course. She is highly knowledgable, her grading criteria is clear, her lectures are pertinent to the field of process improvement, she provides study guides that are the same as the tests & cares about her student's success!
